conclusion: To find the time at which the two waves meet, determine how long it takes for the wave traveling from the left and the wave traveling from the right to reach the same point.
The wave source on the left is at x = -0.2 m.
The wave source on the right is at x = 1.2 m.
The two waves will meet somewhere between the points x = -0.2 m and x = 1.2 m.
Calculate the total distance between the two sources: Total distance = 1.2 m - (-0.2 m) = 1.4 m.
Find the midpoint where the waves meet: Midpoint = (1.2 m + (-0.2 m))/2 = 0.5 m.
Calculate the distance the left wave travels to reach the midpoint: d_left = 0.5 m - (-0.2 m) = 0.7 m.
Calculate the distance the right wave travels to reach the midpoint: d_right = 1.2 m - 0.5 m = 0.7 m.
Both waves have a speed of 0.4 m/s.
Determine the time it takes for each wave to travel to the midpoint: t = d/v = 0.7 m / 0.4 m/s = 1.75 s.
The two waves will meet at t = 1.75 s.
